p: Houston’s first health initiative for men who have sex with men (MSM) was launched by a gay activist, Ray Hill, who created and distributed a trifold flyer about sexually transmitted infections (STIs) in gay bars during the 1960s [ 8]. Later, “Dan the VD Man,” from the Houston Health Department, pioneered (mobile) STI testing at gay bars in 1976, followed in 1978 by “Mother Ruth” Ravas [ 8].
